thread.title: Teen lesbians’ fury as Morrisons worker says KISSING 'putting people off food'
thread.title_full: Teen lesbians’ fury as Morrisons worker says KISSING 'putting people off food'

title: Teen lesbians’ fury as Morrisons worker says KISSING 'putting people off food'
text:
GUZELIAN LESBIANS: Teen couple Chloe Arrandale and Louise Taylor claim they were shouted at 
Chloe Arrandale and girlfriend Louise Taylor, both 18, were eating in the Eccles branch of the supermarket on Thursday when the alleged incident happened. 
Louise claims she kissed her girlfriend because she wasn’t feeling well when they were approached by a security guard. 
He allegedly started shouting at the young couple, telling them that what they did was “disgusting” and they were “putting people off their food”. 
They also claim the guard told them: “You should go outside if you want to act like that." Inside Dinah Shore: All female pool party Friday, 8th April 2016 Take a look into Dinah Shore the all female pool party in Palm Springs. 1 / 14 Take a look into Dinah Shore the all female pool party in Palm Springs “It wasn't a really long, sloppy snog” Chloe Arrandale 
College student Chloe said: “I want an apology from this man and for him to admit what he has done is wrong. 
“Love is love. If he has these opinions then he should just keep them to himself and not just go screaming at two young girls. 
“All she (Louise) did was sit next to me, put her arm around me and gave me a kiss because I was not feeling well. It wasn't a really long, sloppy snog.” 
She added: “I have been going to this Morrisons since I was young and the staff are always great. 
“We come to the store almost every day after college. We don't blame Morrisons for this, as we have never had any problems. It was just the actions of one particular person.” 
GETTY INVESTIGATION: Morrisons said it is looking into the alleged incident 
Morrisons has since said it is investigating the alleged incident, saying it “doesn’t sound like the kind of service” customers should expect. 
The store also responded to Facebook posts written by Chloe and her mum expressing their outrage. 
“We get the occasional glances when we are out together or little shouts from childish boys but never had anyone scream at us before. Louise was just sat there quiet because she was in shock,” Chloe added. 
A Morrisons spokesman said: “We take this allegation extremely seriously and we are raising it with our security supplier at this store to find out what happened.” Related articles
